derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (as an adjective in the sense 'made of wood from the lime tree'): from lind 'lime tree' (compare with lime) + -en, reinforced by obsolete Dutch lindenboom and German Lindenbaum

entry.def: A linden or a linden tree is a large tree with pale green leaves which is often planted in parks in towns and cities.

means.word_mean: 1. soft light-colored wood of any of various linden trees; used in making crates and boxes and in carving and millwork
2. any of various deciduous trees of the genus Tilia with heart-shaped leaves and drooping cymose clusters of yellowish often fragrant flowers; several yield valuable timber
